oai_dc:dc.dc:title: carbine thimble
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The carbine thimble was issued to most Union cavalrymen. The leather thimble attached to a "D" ring on the right side of the McClellan saddle via the small leather strap. The trooper's carbine suspended muzzle down from a carbine sling on the right side of the horse. The muzzle fitted into the thimble to prevent the carbine from bouncing against horse and rider. This example was made under contract by Emanuel Metzger of Phildalephia probably between November 1864 and March 1865.
